page.title: 20A Day in an Adult's Life
page.content: As a working mother, I get up at 7.40 am each week day and I am washed and dressed by 8.00 am when I have my breakfast which consists of cereal, toast and tea. I do the dishes and make the beds before I leave at 8.50 am for school where I am a primary teacher. I travel to school by car. I teach maths and reading up until 12.30 pm, then I have my lunch which normally consists of fruit. At 1.30 pm we go to singing games. The children go home at 2.30 pm. At 3.15 pm I can go home but I only do so once I have marked all the jotters so quite often I don't get home until 4.00 pm. When I arrive home I do housework such as washing or ironing. Then I prepare and have tea. After this I do any preparation necessary for school the next day. I have supper before going to bed at 11.00 pm.
